intro: Thlaspi dolichocarpum, commonly known as the long-fruited rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arctic environments. Its fruit is a long, slender silique, which is a type of dry fruit that splits open to release seeds. Thlaspi dolichocarpum is adapted to cold climates and is found in various regions across the Northern Hemisphere.
